sections.heading: officers; when elected; qualifications
sections.text: The officers of the township board shall be elected pursuant to the Election Act at the next general election held in November following appointment and shall have the qualifications required by sections 23-214 and 23-215.SourceLaws 1895, c. 28, § 20, p. 137;R.

23-222.Township officers; when elected; qualifications.

The officers of the township board shall be elected pursuant to the Election Act at the next general election held in November following appointment and shall have the qualifications required by sections 23-214 and 23-215.

SourceLaws 1895, c. 28, § 20, p. 137;R.S.1913, § 1006;C.S.1922, § 908;C.S.1929, § 26-222;R.S.1943, § 23-222;Laws 1994, LB 76, § 538;Laws 1997, LB 764, § 6;Laws 2003, LB 461, § 1.

Cross ReferencesElection Act, see section 32-101.

Annotations

Although each township has a township board and township officers, each of which has statutorily prescribed powers and duties, the powers of the township are exercised through direct local self-government. Butler County Dairy v. Butler County, 285 Neb. 408, 827 N.W.2d 267 (2013).

Road overseer is officer of township. Town of Denver v. Myers, 63 Neb. 107, 88 N.W. 191 (1901).
